definition: to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

pinyin: jian4 she4 xing4 de5 pi1 ping2

sentences.english: At no time, though, did Reagan ever criticize the United Nations specifically.
sentences.chinese: 但里根從未對聯合國提出過明確的批評。

sentences.english: What is the theoretical background of the Formalistic Approaches ?
sentences.chinese: 形式主義批評的理論背景是什麼？

sentences.english: A critic is a legless man who teaches running.
sentences.chinese: 批評家，是教人跑步的無腿的人。

sentences.english: While reluctant to criticize the status quo, the guides often let things slip out in conversation.
sentences.chinese: 導遊不願意批評現狀，但在交談中會不時漏嘴。

sentences.english: Do you think the news media in Hong Kong have any scruple about criticizing the XX Government?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得香港新聞傳媒系批評XX政府既時候有冇顧忌？

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授嚴厲批評了我的粗心錯誤。

sentences.english: If you serve like Jesus, you can expect to be criticized.
sentences.chinese: 假若你像耶穌那樣地服事，必然會受到批評。

sentences.english: She blushed when they criticized her for her incorrect attitude toward labour.
sentences.chinese: 當他們批評她對勞動的不正確態度時，她臉紅了。

sentences.english: Without film history , film critique has no difference with well no source.
sentences.chinese: 缺少電影史，電影批評仿若無源之泉。

sentences.english: S. officials have dismissed the Chinese proposal as 'untethered from reality.
sentences.chinese: 美國官員曾批評中國的建議太不現實。

sentences.english: These commence and criticism are inevitable and not at all surprizing.
sentences.chinese: 這些評論和批評是必然的，並不令人感到奇怪。

sentences.english: Come writers and critics. Who prophesize with your pen.
sentences.chinese: 來吧，預言以筆的作家，批評家們。

sentences.english: It has encountered many unfavorable criticisms.
sentences.chinese: 同時，還遇到許多不利的批評。

sentences.english: Your constant criticism has deadened their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 你接二連三地批評降低了他們的熱情。

sentences.english: She blushed when we criticized he for incorrect attitude to ward labour.
sentences.chinese: 當我們批評她對待勞動的不正確態度時，她臉紅了。

sentences.english: There are the metaphor phenomena by diet in Chinese ancient literature and art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 藝術批評中普遍存在着喜好借用飲食譬喻的現象。

definition: to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
